page.title: 05HIGH HURSTWOOD MILL
page.content: This used to be a forge-mill used for making iron in the 16th and 17th centuries but when the iron industry ended it became a flour mill with the miller living in the stables of the nearby farm which was also built in the 16th century. It has a cast-iron wheel instead of the more usual wooden wheel to drive the mill and was made by a well-known local firm in Lewes. It is a small building of three floors, the first of which is brick and the next ones of overlapped weatherboarding. The mill was worked until 1941 and then the stream which turned the wheel was filled with reeds and therefore the work stopped. The farmhouse, however, remains as a very charming home and the stables are now garages.
